title: how much does swelling really go down?
post:
i’m currently a little over 3 weeks post op and have been healing very well! got a bit of T-junction breakdown which is annoying but my surgeon isn’t worried so i feel pretty good. 

the only thing is, i feel like my breasts haven’t really gone down in size from day 1 of post op? i know that i can’t really know my size accurately at least until a couple months after surgery, but also shouldn’t i notice some decrease in swelling by now?

like everyone else i’m worried i’ll end up bigger than anticipated and want to know if i should prepare myself for only minor changes in my size going forward. 

tl;dr was the change from early recovery to a couple months post op noticeable/significant? what was your experience with swelling after reduction like?
disclosure: a little over 3 weeks post op
label: Health

comment: My experience (it seems like many people's experience on here) was that swelling was at its peak around week 3.  We're all different, but know that you might be in the height of your swelling.
label: Health

title: How painful are snake bites?
post: So I'm planning on getting snake bites but I'm kinda scared that they are gonna be too painful so I wanna know how much they really hurt
disclosure: I'm planning on getting snake bites
label: Interests

title: How painful are snake bites?
post: So I'm planning on getting snake bites but I'm kinda scared that they are gonna be too painful so I wanna know how much they really hurt
comment: I’ve had my labret and medusa pierced and for the pain level for both was very similar to getting my ear lobes pierced (with a cannula) so I’d assume it would be similar for snake bites. So for me it wasn’t that much more painful tbh. The big difference you have to consider is the after care and also getting used to a mouth piercing, which can take a lot of patience. Your lips move a lot and that can contribute to the initial swelling in the first few days. I found with my lip piercings as long as I didn’t talk too much and ate and drank carefully it wasn’t too bad. So keep this in mind, it’s not just the initial pain you should be prepared for, it’s the discomfort during healing you should consider too.
disclosure: I’ve had my labret and medusa pierced
label: Appearance

title: How painful are snake bites?
post: So I'm planning on getting snake bites but I'm kinda scared that they are gonna be too painful so I wanna know how much they really hurt
comment: It really depends on your own pain tolerance, but I just got my snakebites done and they weren’t that bad for me (and I also have a terrible pain tolerance). The only other piercing I can compare it to is my septum piercing, and while snakebites did hurt more than that one, the pain didn’t last as long. Snakebites are very quick, and feel a lot like an aggressive pinch, really. I’ve had my snakebites for only a week, but they only ached for a few hours after I got them and when they get too dry/crusty. Good luck and I hope this helps!!
label: Appearance

title: What should I upgrade to improve fps in tarkov the most?
post:
Current specs:  
Ryzen 5 2600

16gb 2400mhz ram

1650 Super (4gb vram)

Haven't the budget to upgrade all of these so if I was to choose one or two which would make the most impact do you reckon? thanks
label: Possession

title: What should I upgrade to improve fps in tarkov the most?
post:
Current specs:  
Ryzen 5 2600

16gb 2400mhz ram

1650 Super (4gb vram)

Haven't the budget to upgrade all of these so if I was to choose one or two which would make the most impact do you reckon? thanks
comment:
y’all are crazy, i had a really well OC’d 5600xt and my 2600x barely, if at all bottlenecked it, and ONLY in this game. his gpu would make more difference.

also adding that in 1080p on low textures this game maxed out the vram on that 6gb card as well so im positive he’s also having problems there. YES, going from the 2600x to a newer and more powerful CPU made an extensive difference but that would only be the case if he were underutilizing his almost certainly maxed out 1650..
label: Possession

title: Sex Education Survey (Repost)
post: Hello, my name is Rachael and I am a doctoral student in clinical psychology at the University of Indianapolis. I am conducting a research study on sexual education and well-being and would like you to consider participating. Participation in the study means a brief (\~10 minute) research survey about sexual education and sexual well-being. This study will help build insight into sex education programming and how it impacts individuals in early adulthood. If you agree to participate, you must be a U.S. Citizen, between age 18 and 30, and currently enrolled in college or university. Participants must also be neurodivergent (have a diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder, Autism, or Asperger’s Syndrome). To participate, click [here](https://uindy.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0J05E476iV0OU1E).
label: Name

title: Suing my former employer Softsages Technologies.
post:
Currently in the process of suing my former employer [SoftSages Technology](https://www.linkedin.com/company/softsages-technology/)   as it took them nearly 2 weeks after my final termination a few months   ago to service my final paycheck and failed to pay the 3 week  severance  promised at document signing. Then flat lied to DoL saying  that I was a  contractor even though I signed a w2 and they withheld  taxes from my  paychecks. Luckily I still have a copy of every email and  form ever sent/signed.

Fair warning to anyone who intends to work at [SoftSages Technology](https://www.linkedin.com/company/softsages-technology/)  


Position lasted all of a week after I moved across state to get to it.
label: Occupation

title: Just sharing a bit of a bad experience
post:
Well, it's not a long tale. 

I did my first buy in Superbuy in October, and in the end it amounted to five parcels. Overall things went good for me, as I received three of them in the estimated time ( between Registered Air and EUB ) , and there's one that, although I still have not received, it's ok, because that one is SAL so it was expected. The problem is the fifth one, that was shipped with Registered Air Mail. It's now on the day sixty five of shipping, stuck in "Plane has landed" since day eight of November ( and that update just showed up in the day 28 of November ). 

Well, that's it. I know that's not Superbuy fault, as the one's handling the parcel now are couriers and etc, but I just wanted do blow some steam by writing it down. Sorry for any grammar error, English is not my mother language.
disclosure: English is not my mother language
label: Other

title: Sometimes I don’t care about quitting
post:
I just think, fuck being in the 2% or whatever that successfully beats this shit

title: First internship
post: Hi all, I will be applying for my first internship at an architect this spring with the work coming in the summer, I’ve only been in architecture for 2 years and don’t feel I have the best portfolio of work to show, what are ways to ensure I get a position where I want, and is the hiring process super portfolio-centric, anything Is helpful, thank you!!
disclosure: I will be applying for my first internship at an architect
label: Occupation

title: First internship
post: Hi all, I will be applying for my first internship at an architect this spring with the work coming in the summer, I’ve only been in architecture for 2 years and don’t feel I have the best portfolio of work to show, what are ways to ensure I get a position where I want, and is the hiring process super portfolio-centric, anything Is helpful, thank you!!
comment: I think the hiring process is really different between firms. I got my first internship after my second year and they didn’t even look at the portfolio I submitted, but most firms understand that you don’t have much work to submit at this point. Just put together your projects from school and hope for the best.
label: Occupation

title: First internship
post: Hi all, I will be applying for my first internship at an architect this spring with the work coming in the summer, I’ve only been in architecture for 2 years and don’t feel I have the best portfolio of work to show, what are ways to ensure I get a position where I want, and is the hiring process super portfolio-centric, anything Is helpful, thank you!!

label: Time

title: First internship
post: Hi all, I will be applying for my first internship at an architect this spring with the work coming in the summer, I’ve only been in architecture for 2 years and don’t feel I have the best portfolio of work to show, what are ways to ensure I get a position where I want, and is the hiring process super portfolio-centric, anything Is helpful, thank you!!
comment:
I just visited local firms and none of them even asked for one. They basically just had casual interviews. One of them offered me an internship right after and I took it. One of the firms I contacted mostly just wanted to know if I was proficient in revit then I asked if he'd like a portfolio and he just said "no, you're too early in your degree for a portfolio to tell me much" (or something like that). This was while I was in third year. 

Obviously it's different for everyone and portfolios are important, but reaching out to people and having a face to face conversation goes a loooong way, especially since a lot of younger people today are so anxious about making phone calls and meeting people in person (which is a HUGE part of architecture in practice.) Showing someone you're a smart, likable, pleasant person can go farther than a portfolio. 

You could even just call up a firm and ask if they can show you around their office and talk about projects they're working on if it's hard to land an actual interview.
disclosure: offered me an internship right after and I took it
label: Occupation

title: Does POC suffice for MD order?
post: I off-ramped for too long from the profession and missed the part about Direct Access.  Just learning about it now at my new HH (Med B) job.  In searching this out, I learned that my state (NY) is DA but requires MD order at 30 days / 10 visits.  So in not trusting the company I work for, I'd like legit ethical answers from my PT community here as to what that really means at 30 days/10 visits?  Does the POC signed by a MD suffice for this state requirement?  Does Medicare also accept this?
label: Occupation
